Question:

Does this add lightnings anyhow?

This and the following two posts:

1 hour ago, Gordon Dry said:

Question:

Does this add lightnings anyhow?

This and the following two posts:

 

Man, why does everyone think the lightning flashes are bugs? Yes, there are fully intentional lightning strikes in this mod.

So then I repeat the question:

Why are they so heavily blue? I suggest them being more white.

Just now, Gordon Dry said:

So then I repeat the question:

Why are they so heavily blue? I suggest them being more white.

The lightning texture in the original AVP really was that blue, so I decided to stick with it. I'll up the whiteness in the bugfix today.

I'm not sure if there's a known fix for this, but hopefully someone can help.

 

I'm getting what looks like a glitchy atmosphere sometimes. It's basically a big planet sized sphere that flickers a lot. I've noticed it a bunch around Minmus lately.

 

Someone mentioned enabling E.V.E. integration in a previous post, tried that, didn't fix.

 

Looked back, same as this post, 2nd picture. Doesn't look like he got a reply/fix.

 

Edited July 8, 2017 by Dortmunder

48 minutes ago, Dortmunder said:

I'm not sure if there's a known fix for this, but hopefully someone can help.

 

I'm getting what looks like a glitchy atmosphere sometimes. It's basically a big planet sized sphere that flickers a lot. I've noticed it a bunch around Minmus lately.

 

Someone mentioned enabling E.V.E. integration in a previous post, tried that, didn't fix.

 

Looked back, same as this post, 2nd picture. Doesn't look like he got a reply/fix.

 

Because of how the visual enhancement scene is at the moment, the file structure of the mod changes slightly almost every update. I recommend wiping out the entirety of AVP before installing the latest update, it may fix some issues. Anyways, that issue seems like it's coming from scatterer. Update your scatterer to the 1.3 version.

As for other issues, especially with the file structure, I understand a couple of features need fixing. Unfortunately I did not have the time to do that today, so hopefully I'll get around to it tomorrow.

Edited July 8, 2017 by themaster401

On ‎7‎/‎3‎/‎2017 at 1:40 PM, themaster401 said:

I suspect that's a scatterer bug that I cannot fix.

Most of you may have noticed the lack of citylights in the past updates. I am thoroughly confused with how EVE handles CityLights, because even after perfectly aligning lights with a kerbin map:

It looks like this ingame:

With the citylights diving into the ocean.

This is because the map of kerbin is a dds texture and is flipped when it is loaded into the game. flip your city lights texture vertically and save it, then see in game.

 

Edited July 8, 2017 by Galileo

Hi, I am having troubles getting the mod installed on a fresh install of KSP 1.3. I have figured out that I need to get the latest release on GitHub and have found the updated list of dependencies. I installed all the dependencies into made gamedata folder and made sure the game could run. Then I installed the AVP 3.4 files and it worked, sort of. The first issue I noticed is that when viewing the mun from Kerbin only half of it is rendered with the mods visuals. Next was that Laythe's night side was bright and had a blue hue to all of it, also Moho non longer had the dust hemisphere in front of it's day side. When launching from Kerbin, after climbing above the clouds, there is a clear divide between atmosphere and space that isn't very pleasing. Last, there are no city lights on Kerbin's night side. I followed the limited instructions given as best I could. I might have messed up in the installation process but all I was told to do was download and install the dependencies and then AVP 3.4 and after following that I'm having these issues. I would love to use this visual mod. I think it brings the best visuals to KSP, but I'm frustrated that even after digging to find out where to get the latest files, and following the install instructions, the pack still is not fully working as expected. Hopefully there's a simple fix for this, can't wait to use the mod.

p.s.

The clouds look very melted and liquid. Like wet water paint, I dont know if this is how it's suppose to be but it doesn't look right from what I've seen of other's installs.

I would give screen shots but I cant figure out how to get them on this post. I apologize.

Edited July 8, 2017 by brendanizmoarawesome

Astronomer's Visual Pack - v3.41 "Universality"

- Please feel free to bother me more about bugs and things that need to be fixed. I want to release a version that will stick for more than just a week.

- CityLights fixed.

- Sunflare changed.

- Lightning brighter.

https://github.com/themaster402/AstronomersVisualPack/releases

Edited July 8, 2017 by themaster401

On 06/07/2017 at 1:07 AM, themaster401 said:

That's literally intentional thunder in the sky LOL. It's part of the pack.

If you want to remove it, do it through the EVE GUI in the Tracking Station.

AHahahahah sorry master , thank you
I love the new city lights!

15 minutes ago, Zayne Kerman said:

I love the new city lights!

Well that was the first compliment on this topic XD

Thank you! I know the citylights are a bit scrappy, so feel free to give some feedback on that!

On 7/7/2017 at 1:12 PM, themaster401 said:

The lightning texture in the original AVP really was that blue, so I decided to stick with it. I'll up the whiteness in the bugfix today.

I can't believe people nitpick over the color, I'm just plain amazed that it's THERE.

Anyways, my two cents, to my eyes, the real thing IS blue tinged. Remember (whomever suggested the color change), it's not going to look like lighthing from the ground, it's going to be THROUGH cloud cover. Here's an example video from the ISS...

 

Updated from 3.40 to 3.41, KSP 1.2.2 64bit on Windows 10.

Can you confirm that city lights at the KSC and covering the mountain in the background (under the 1x) is not how this should be?

Upload screenshots to imgur.com, then right click on your uploaded screenshot and copy the link location, and paste that link into your post.

Upload screenshots to imgur.com, then right click on your uploaded screenshot and copy the link location, and paste that link into your post.

 

CityLights mostly look odd because of the detailtexture, which I grabbed from stock EVE configs. When I have time, I'll fix that up. They look natural from orbit nonetheless.

(quoted the wrong post woops whatever)

Is anyone else getting the bug where the sky turns like a negative image?

Also getting an old bug where you get a ghosted circular silhouette of the planet when in map mode.  Is there a solution to resolve this?

On 7/9/2017 at 9:14 PM, ctbram said:

Is anyone else getting the bug where the sky turns like a negative image?

Also getting an old bug where you get a ghosted circular silhouette of the planet when in map mode.  Is there a solution to resolve this?

what ksp version you running?

On 7/10/2017 at 0:14 AM, ctbram said:

Is anyone else getting the bug where the sky turns like a negative image?

Also getting an old bug where you get a ghosted circular silhouette of the planet when in map mode.  Is there a solution to resolve this?

I was getting both of these with a prior version of AVP (version 3.1.3E) on KSP 1.3 (latest release on Steam). After a lot of trial and error, I found the issue was related to using 8K cloud textures. When I dropped down to 4K textures, the problem disappeared completely. I just installed the latest version this morning and used the 4K textures and haven't seen the issue. I tried the 8K textures again and it crashed my computer hard. I have a fairly beefy rig (dual EVGA 980 TI's SLI'd, 64 GB RAM, etc.), but am running 5760x1080, so I think the 8K textures were just too much.

Edited July 11, 2017 by LordScarlet
Added detail on version of KSP running.
Quickfix for some issues is now out on GitHub. It's still AVP.v.3.41.zip, but the files have been altered in the download slightly.

Hey I am a little confused as to what to install here. Do I get the download from GitHub or spacedock? there is a massive difference in file size and above you mentioned a fix in the GitHub version. Also I cant find the different texture packs you mention in the OP...am I just missing something? haha

Edit:

okay so are the KSPRC textures instead of the AVP textures then? This mod looks so awesome but I have never been so confused trying to install a mod :-D I think you really need a detailed install instructions in the OP because this is super confusing,

Edit 2: 

I am guessing we just download EVE, and not the EVE configs as well?

Edit 3: lol

Right I think I have everything installed correctly now haha. Just loading KSP which takes like 20 mins with all my mods. So fingers crossed I have done it right :-P

Right it all seems to be working fine now :-D Really looks amazing so even though it was a pain getting confused it was worth it :-)
